JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Christos Rozakis;Dean Spielmann;George Nicolaou;Giorgio Malinverni;Khanlar Hajiyev
TEXT: The applicant , ORG , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE , a village in LOC . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by PERSON , the former Representative of GPE at ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

The applicant was a shareholder of a private joint - stock road - building company “ GPE DSPMK ” ( “ PERSON ДСПМК ” ) . On an unspecified date in DATE she applied to a court to oblige the company to redeem her CARDINAL nominal shares .
On DATE ORG of GPE declared the company insolvent . On DATE an insolvency administrator , Mr N. , was appointed for the insolvency proceedings .
On DATE ORG obliged the company to redeem the CARDINAL nominal shares held in the company by the applicant . On DATE the ORG upheld the judgment and it became final and enforceable .
On DATE the applicant sought enforcement in court .
On DATE the court sent the writ of execution to the local ORG .

On DATE the bailiff served the writ of execution on PERSON instead of PERSON , the administrator . However , PERSON forwarded the writ to Mr N. without delay and the writ was received by Mr. PERSON on DATE .
As the shares were not redeemed by the company , the applicant complained about the bailiffs’ failure to act to the court and to the local ORG .

On DATE the applicant ’s complaints were upheld by ORG . The court reproached the bailiff for negligence in serving the writ on the wrong person and stated that as the applicant had lodged her claim with the court before the company went insolvent , the enforcement proceedings should have been carried out by the bailiff within the civil procedure in accordance with ORG ( ORG РФ “ Об исполнительном производстве ” ) .
On DATE the same court again upheld an identical complaint lodged by the applicant and ordered the bailiff to pursue the enforcement proceedings .

On DATE ORG of GPE closed the insolvency proceedings , having declared the PERSON registered claims paid off . The company had not redeemed the applicant ’s shares as she was fifth in the line of creditors and the company ’s assets did not suffice .

On DATE the Presidium of the ORG quashed the decision of DATE and discontinued the proceedings . The court found that the instruction contained in the operative part of the judgment of DATE provided for service of the writ of execution on the company ’s insolvency administrator for enforcement . This requirement had been fully complied with by the bailiff . The Presidium of ORG also found that there had been procedural flaws , noting , inter alia , that ORG had disregarded the previous decision concerning the same complaint and pointed out that it had failed to indicate the legal grounds for upholding the applicant ’s complaint .
Under section CARDINAL of LAW of DATE , a bailiff must enforce a judgment within DATE .

The Russian Law on Enforcement Proceedings ( no . CARDINAL-ФЗ of DATE ) designates the court bailiffs’ service as the authority charged with enforcement of court decisions ( section CARDINAL § CARDINAL ) . Court judgments can also be executed by tax authorities , banks , financial institutions , other organisations , ORG officials and individuals – all of these are not considered to be the enforcement authorities ( section CARDINAL ) .
